dmca.title: FreeGovMoney.Net Complains of Copyright Infringement
dmca.body:
To: Google Copyright Complaints 
Fax number: [private]

A facsimile from
FreeGovMoney.Net
[private]
[private] Riverside, CA 92507
[private]

Date: 10/21/2004
Regarding: Copyright Infringement

Comments: It has come to my attention that http://www.business-grants.org & http://www.government-grants.ws have made unauthorized use of my copyrighted work entitled http://www.freegovmoney.net (the "Work") in the preparation of a work derived therefrom. I have reserved all rights in the Work, which was first published in December 2002, and I have registered the copyright.

Their works entitled http://www.business-grants.org & http://www.govemment-grants.ws are essentially identical to www.freegovmoney.net and clearly used the www.freegovmoney.net as their basis.

They neither asked for nor received permission to use www.freegovmoney.net as the basis for http://www.business-grants.org & http://www.government-grants.ws nor to make or distribute copies of it. Therefore, I believe they have willfully infringed my rights under 17 USC Section 101, et seq. and could be liable for statutory damages as high as $100,000.

When doing a search on the Google search engine the domain http://www.businessgrants.org appears on your Search Engine Results Pages under keyword phrases such as "free government grants." If you click on the link for http://www.business-grants.org you are actually re-directed to www.government-grants.org. However if you copy and paste the URL displayed on your Search Engine Results Pages you will be directed to the actual website that contains the infringed content.

It is requested that you remove these items from circulation immediately.

I have a good faith belief that use of the trademarks [sic] described above were not authorized by the trademark [sic] owner or its agent, nor is such use otherwise permissible under law.

I represent that the information in this notification is true and correct and that I am authorized to act on behalf of the trademark [sic] owner.

Sincerely 
[private]
FreeGovmoney.Net
[private]@freegovmoney.net
